>X-Sender: ralfred@pop.igc.apc.org
>Mime-Version: 1.0
>Date: Mon, 17 Jun 1996 19:51:42 -0700
>To: contentedit@netguide.com, copyedit@netguide.com
>From: ralfred@igc.org (Randy Alfred)
>Subject: the 80's
>Sender: ralfred@igc.org
>
>>
>>     Alright people, now there is no excuse! You THINK you
>>remember everything about when you grew up - that magnificent decade
>>called the Eighties. Well, here's a slight quiz to test your knowledge.
>>Don't be fooled by some of the easy questions, for there are others that
>>you'll agonize over because you can remember their faces, but their names
>>are lost somewhere in your subconscious. And, oh, this may be a bit hard
>>for non-Americans, but try to relate anyway! after you blow your mind, send
>>it to fellow 80's children and see if they remember the days of Fruit
>>Roll-Ups and Menudo as well as they say they do. Good luck and have fun!
>>
>>
>>* * * * * * * * * 80 QUESTIONS ABOUT THE EIGHTIES * * * * * * * * *
>>
>>1. What was the British equivalent of "We Are The World?"
>>2. Name six members of the Brat Back
>>3. What Liverpool band popularized the Doors' "People Are Strange?" in the
>>     80's?
>>4. Who had the trademark saying "Nanoo Nanoo?"
>>5. What was the original name of Duran Duran?
>>6. What was the name of ET's favorite candy?
>>7. What did people desperately try to avoid getting on "Press Your
>>     Luck?"
>>8. Name 3 books by Judy Blume or Beverly Cleary
>>9. Who was the leader of the Transformers?
>>10. Where did the Superfriends congregate and watch the latest
>>     happenings on a big screen TV?
>>11. What group did New Order evolve from?
>>12. What were the names of Kevin's best friend and girl friend on
>>     "The Wonder Years?"
>>13. What was the name of the mechanical bear on Battlestar Galactica?
>>14. What commercial was Michael Jackson singing for when his hair
>>     caught on fire?
>>15. Who was the 4th child on "Growing Pains?"
>>16. Name 3 Strawberry Shortcake characters (besides Strawberry
>>     Shortcake)
>>17. What, according to GI Joe, was "Half the battle"?
>>18. What was the name of the Bjork-fronted 80's band?
>>19. Who lamented about "No chocolate-covered candy hearts to give
>>     away and no wedding Saturday within the month of June"?
>>20. What famous Wham! frontman went on to record a multi-platinum
>>     record in 1987?
>>21. What was Dustin Hoffman's character's name in "Rain Man?"
>>22. Name all five New Kids On The Block
>>23. What was the name of the show that featured Larry Appleton and
>>     his zany foreign cousin?
>>24. Who played Sarah Connor in 1984's "Terminator"?
>>25. Name 8 Muppets from "The Muppet Show"
>>26. Who was the actress that played Ferris Bueller's sister? Hint:
>>     Patrick Swayze showed her "the time of her life" in a movie a couple
>>     years
>>     later
>>27. Who was the original singer of Los Lobos' 1987 hit "La Bamba"?
>>28. What was the name of the once Morrissey-fronted band in the 80's?
>>29. Who was the actress that made waves in 1984's "Splash"?
>>30. Who was the lead actress in the famous bomb "Grease 2"?
>>31. What craft toy involved cutting plastic figures, coloring them
>>     in, and then baking them in the oven?
>>32. Name 3 glam rock bands of the 80's
>>33. What planet was Spock brought back to life on?
>>34. Name 3 of the actors from "The Goonies"
>>35. What was the famous line uttered by an old woman in Wendy's ads?
>>36. Name the four ghosts from Pac-Man
>>37. What were the names of the Saturday morning cartoon critters who
>>     lived in air-vents and befriended a boy who kept their secret hidden?
>>38. Name Eddie Murphy's skit about vocabulary on Saturday Night Live
>>39. What was the name of Michael Knight's car? ....now, what was the
>>     name of his boss?
>>40. What actor mouthed the line "Whatch you talkin' 'bout Willis?"
>>41. Who played Axel Foley's best friend in Detroit?
>>42. What was the name of the funky van Scooby Doo and friends rode
>>     in?
>>43. To what does the obscure song "Turning Japanese" refer?
>>44. Which red-head won Star Search and then went on a shopping mall
>>     singing tour that took America by storm in 1987 and 1988?
>>45. Which band had members Robert Palmer, Andy and John Taylor,  and
>>     Tony Thompson?
>>46. What were the names of all five Huxtable kids on "The Cosby
>>     Show?"
>>47. What were the names of the four Golden Girls?
>>48. What was the claymation Domino's Pizza thing to avoid?
>>49. What oldies song was revived by the movie about a certain
>>     principal named Joe Clark?
>>50. What was the name of Ripley's ship in Aliens? (not Alien or
>>     Alien3)
>>51. What TV actress costarred in 1986's "Howard The Duck"?
>>52. Name 5 movies made by John Hughes in the 1980's
>>53. What was the first video played on MTV?
>>54. What was the name of Garfield's teddy bear?
>>55. What was the name of the bartender on "The Love Boat"?
>>56. Who was the head villain on "The Smurfs" and what was his cat's
>>     name?
>>57. What was the name of the guy who couldn't enunciate on "The Fat
>>     Albert Show?"
>>58. What was the name of the hollow hole-covered plastic ball kids
>>     used to hit instead of a baseball?
>>59. What was the name of the singer who died in Robotech's first
>>     generation?
>>60. What was the name of Bo and Luke Duke's automobile?
>>61. Name 2 of the original 4 MTV VeeJays
>>62. What German siren sang "99 Luftballons" (known in the US as "99
>>     Red Balloons")?
>>63. Name the 5th original member of Depeche Mode who left the band,
>>     formed Yaz, and then went on form a more-lasting group.
>>64. What group sang "Come On Eileen"?
>>65. What speed did Marty have to reach in order to activate the flux
>>     capacitor? (once you remember the movie, this should be easy)
>>66. Name the two mega-popular bands which got their start on
>>     college-radio in Athens, Georgia?
>>67. What was the name of the heroic boy in "The Never Ending Story?
>>68. So, who shot JR?
>>69. What kind of sword did Thundar the Barbarian have?
>>70. What was the name of He-Man's magician sidekick?
>>71. What band sang the theme song to "The Breakfast Club?"
>>72. Name the 4 girls from the "Facts of Life" and their chaperone
>>73. What gothic rock group did Tones on Tail become?
>>74. What were the names of the host and his sidekick on "Fantasy
>>     Island"?
>>75. Name Buck Rodgers' pal
>>76. What was the movie that starred the little furry creatures from
>>     "Return of the Jedi"?
>>77. What was Tom Cruise's call sign in the movie "Top Gun"?
>>78. Who got his 100-meter dash gold medal stripped away due to his
>>     steroid use in the 1988 Olympics?
>>79. Who sang "Shattered Dreams" in 1987?
>>80. Who played Ming of Mongo in "Flash Gordon"?
>>
>

Matt L wrote us an apology about dropping the ball on the Yosemite trip ....
_____________

Hey Matt,

On behalf of all of the people who were interested in the Yosemite trip...
(OK, OK I know I can only speak for myself!)  .... please don't feel you've
flaked on us ... cuz the truth is that every single person who said they wanted
to go, but wasn't working with you to make it work, is also responsible for it
not happening....

You know the story of the farmer (oh god, was it a chicken?) who said, who'll
help me plow this field?  and no one offered to help. "who'll help me plant
these seeds?"  no one .... "who'll help me harvest this wheat?"  no one ....
"who'll help me bake this bread?"  then..... "who'll help me eat this bread?"
"I WILL!  I WILL!  I WILL!"

I myself have been feeling like I had slipped on checking in about this, plus
I'm so busy, I couldn't have made it anyway!

I wonder if we should start loooking at a much later date so we can get a great
place with plenty of notice?  (Hey, not that I'm volunteering or anything!)

Leslie  : )

ugh. well.. shall we make this a communal effort? here's what i got.. i'm
sure all you "old-timers" will have an easier time than me (at least with
the stuff other than cartoons)

>>>* * * * * * * * * 80 QUESTIONS ABOUT THE EIGHTIES * * * * * * * * *
>>>
>>>1. What was the British equivalent of "We Are The World?"
>>>2. Name six members of the Brat Back
>>>3. What Liverpool band popularized the Doors' "People Are Strange?" in the
>>>     80's?
>>>4. Who had the trademark saying "Nanoo Nanoo?"
mork (sp?)
>>>5. What was the original name of Duran Duran?
>>>6. What was the name of ET's favorite candy?
reece's pieces
>>>7. What did people desperately try to avoid getting on "Press Your
>>>     Luck?"
>>>8. Name 3 books by Judy Blume or Beverly Cleary
>>>9. Who was the leader of the Transformers?
Optimus Prime for the Autobots, Megatron for the Deceptacons - in the later
series, Rodimus Prime and Galvatron.
>>>10. Where did the Superfriends congregate and watch the latest
>>>     happenings on a big screen TV?
>>>11. What group did New Order evolve from?
>>>12. What were the names of Kevin's best friend and girl friend on
>>>     "The Wonder Years?"
gfriend: Winnie  best friend:?
>>>13. What was the name of the mechanical bear on Battlestar Galactica?
>>>14. What commercial was Michael Jackson singing for when his hair
>>>     caught on fire?
>>>15. Who was the 4th child on "Growing Pains?"
>>>16. Name 3 Strawberry Shortcake characters (besides Strawberry
>>>     Shortcake)
hucklberry pie, ?, ?
>>>17. What, according to GI Joe, was "Half the battle"?
"knowing is half the battle"
>>>18. What was the name of the Bjork-fronted 80's band?
the sugarcubes
>>>19. Who lamented about "No chocolate-covered candy hearts to give
>>>     away and no wedding Saturday within the month of June"?
>>>20. What famous Wham! frontman went on to record a multi-platinum
>>>     record in 1987?
george michael.
>>>21. What was Dustin Hoffman's character's name in "Rain Man?"
>>>22. Name all five New Kids On The Block
donny, jordon, ?, ?, ?
>>>23. What was the name of the show that featured Larry Appleton and
>>>     his zany foreign cousin?
>>>24. Who played Sarah Connor in 1984's "Terminator"?
>>>25. Name 8 Muppets from "The Muppet Show"
fozzy bear, kermit the frog, miss piggy, gonzo, animal, dr teeth, beaker,
the swedish chef.
>>>26. Who was the actress that played Ferris Bueller's sister? Hint:
>>>     Patrick Swayze showed her "the time of her life" in a movie a couple
>>>     years
>>>     later
>>>27. Who was the original singer of Los Lobos' 1987 hit "La Bamba"?
>>>28. What was the name of the once Morrissey-fronted band in the 80's?
>>>29. Who was the actress that made waves in 1984's "Splash"?
>>>30. Who was the lead actress in the famous bomb "Grease 2"?
>>>31. What craft toy involved cutting plastic figures, coloring them
>>>     in, and then baking them in the oven?
>>>32. Name 3 glam rock bands of the 80's
>>>33. What planet was Spock brought back to life on?
>>>34. Name 3 of the actors from "The Goonies"
>>>35. What was the famous line uttered by an old woman in Wendy's ads?
>>>36. Name the four ghosts from Pac-Man
blinky, pinky, winky, and ? (all i remember is that it doesn't rhyme)
>>>37. What were the names of the Saturday morning cartoon critters who
>>>     lived in air-vents and befriended a boy who kept their secret hidden?
>>>38. Name Eddie Murphy's skit about vocabulary on Saturday Night Live
>>>39. What was the name of Michael Knight's car? ....now, what was the
>>>     name of his boss?
>>>40. What actor mouthed the line "Whatch you talkin' 'bout Willis?"
>>>41. Who played Axel Foley's best friend in Detroit?
>>>42. What was the name of the funky van Scooby Doo and friends rode
>>>     in?
the mystery machine
>>>43. To what does the obscure song "Turning Japanese" refer?
>>>44. Which red-head won Star Search and then went on a shopping mall
>>>     singing tour that took America by storm in 1987 and 1988?
>>>45. Which band had members Robert Palmer, Andy and John Taylor,  and
>>>     Tony Thompson?
>>>46. What were the names of all five Huxtable kids on "The Cosby
>>>     Show?"
>>>47. What were the names of the four Golden Girls?
>>>48. What was the claymation Domino's Pizza thing to avoid?
"avoid the noid"
>>>49. What oldies song was revived by the movie about a certain
>>>     principal named Joe Clark?
>>>50. What was the name of Ripley's ship in Aliens? (not Alien or
>>>     Alien3)
>>>51. What TV actress costarred in 1986's "Howard The Duck"?
>>>52. Name 5 movies made by John Hughes in the 1980's
>>>53. What was the first video played on MTV?
>>>54. What was the name of Garfield's teddy bear?
pooky
>>>55. What was the name of the bartender on "The Love Boat"?
>>>56. Who was the head villain on "The Smurfs" and what was his cat's
>>>     name?
gargamel and azrael
>>>57. What was the name of the guy who couldn't enunciate on "The Fat
>>>     Albert Show?"
>>>58. What was the name of the hollow hole-covered plastic ball kids
>>>     used to hit instead of a baseball?
>>>59. What was the name of the singer who died in Robotech's first
>>>     generation?
>>>60. What was the name of Bo and Luke Duke's automobile?
>>>61. Name 2 of the original 4 MTV VeeJays
>>>62. What German siren sang "99 Luftballons" (known in the US as "99
>>>     Red Balloons")?
>>>63. Name the 5th original member of Depeche Mode who left the band,
>>>     formed Yaz, and then went on form a more-lasting group.
>>>64. What group sang "Come On Eileen"?
>>>65. What speed did Marty have to reach in order to activate the flux
>>>     capacitor? (once you remember the movie, this should be easy)
>>>66. Name the two mega-popular bands which got their start on
>>>     college-radio in Athens, Georgia?
REM, ?
>>>67. What was the name of the heroic boy in "The Never Ending Story?
>>>68. So, who shot JR?
the fucking FBI/masons/aliens
>>>69. What kind of sword did Thundar the Barbarian have?
>>>70. What was the name of He-Man's magician sidekick?
>>>71. What band sang the theme song to "The Breakfast Club?"
>>>72. Name the 4 girls from the "Facts of Life" and their chaperone
>>>73. What gothic rock group did Tones on Tail become?
is it bauhaus?
>>>74. What were the names of the host and his sidekick on "Fantasy
>>>     Island"?
>>>75. Name Buck Rodgers' pal
>>>76. What was the movie that starred the little furry creatures from
>>>     "Return of the Jedi"?
>>>77. What was Tom Cruise's call sign in the movie "Top Gun"?
>>>78. Who got his 100-meter dash gold medal stripped away due to his
>>>     steroid use in the 1988 Olympics?
ben johnson
>>>79. Who sang "Shattered Dreams" in 1987?
>>>80. Who played Ming of Mongo in "Flash Gordon"?

hmm.. well, maybe i didn't do as well as i originally thought. 
please, enlighten me!

>>>3. What Liverpool band popularized the Doors' "People Are Strange?" in the
>>>     80's?
Echo and the Bunnymen
>>>4. Who had the trademark saying "Nanoo Nanoo?"
Mork
>>>6. What was the name of ET's favorite candy?
Reeces Pieces
>>>11. What group did New Order evolve from?
Joy Division
>>>12. What were the names of Kevin's best friend and girl friend on
>>>     "The Wonder Years?"
Winnie (I had a crush on her), ??
>>>14. What commercial was Michael Jackson singing for when his hair
>>>     caught on fire?
Pepsi
>>>18. What was the name of the Bjork-fronted 80's band?
Sugarcubes
>>>20. What famous Wham! frontman went on to record a multi-platinum
>>>     record in 1987?
George Michael

>>>25. Name 8 Muppets from "The Muppet Show"
Kermit, Miss Piggy, ..............

>>>28. What was the name of the once Morrissey-fronted band in the 80's?
Smiths
>>>35. What was the famous line uttered by an old woman in Wendy's ads?
WHERE'S THE BEEF???
>>>39. What was the name of Michael Knight's car? ....now, what was the
>>>     name of his boss?
Kitt, Devon (Anyone remember what KITT stands for??)
>>>44. Which red-head won Star Search and then went on a shopping mall
>>>     singing tour that took America by storm in 1987 and 1988?
Tiffany
>>>45. Which band had members Robert Palmer, Andy and John Taylor,  and
>>>     Tony Thompson?
Reflex??
>>>48. What was the claymation Domino's Pizza thing to avoid?
Something about the Noid......
>>>53. What was the first video played on MTV?
M - ???
>>>55. What was the name of the bartender on "The Love Boat"?
Izack
>>>56. Who was the head villain on "The Smurfs" and what was his cat's
>>>     name?
Gargamel or something like that.
>>>58. What was the name of the hollow hole-covered plastic ball kids
>>>     used to hit instead of a baseball?
Whiffle Ball
>>>60. What was the name of Bo and Luke Duke's automobile?

>>>62. What German siren sang "99 Luftballons" (known in the US as "99
>>>     Red Balloons")?
Nina??
>>>63. Name the 5th original member of Depeche Mode who left the band,
>>>     formed Yaz, and then went on form a more-lasting group.
Vince Clark
>>>65. What speed did Marty have to reach in order to activate the flux
>>>     capacitor? (once you remember the movie, this should be easy)
80MPH
>>>66. Name the two mega-popular bands which got their start on
>>>     college-radio in Athens, Georgia?
B-52's, REM
>>>67. What was the name of the heroic boy in "The Never Ending Story?
Batian (READ THE BOOK!!  Its really good)
>>>71. What band sang the theme song to "The Breakfast Club?"
"Dont You Forget About Me" Simple Minds
>>>72. Name the 4 girls from the "Facts of Life" and their chaperone
Tootee, ??????
>>>74. What were the names of the host and his sidekick on "Fantasy
>>>     Island"?
Mr. Rorck (SP?) and Tatoo

y'know to eleven...

OK, We're getting close... I've incorporated the following people's   
answers thus far:

Mark D. Camp
Chinley Chang
Kathryn Ankrum
Roy Feague

Still need answers for 5, 15, 16, 30, 37, 38, 41, 46, 47, 49, 50, 57, 61,   
68, 69, 70, 76, & 80...

> >>>* * * * * * * * * 80 QUESTIONS ABOUT THE EIGHTIES * * * * * * * * *
> >>>
1. What was the British equivalent of "We Are The World?"
"Do They Know It's Christmas"?

2. Name six members of the Brat Back
Rob Lowe, Emilio Estevez, Demi Moore, Andrew McCarthy, Judd Nelson,
Ally Sheedy, Molly Ringwald

3. What Liverpool band popularized the Doors' "People Are Strange?" in   
the 80's?
Echo and the Bunnymen

4. Who had the trademark saying "Nanoo Nanoo?"
Mork from Ork (Robin Williams)

5. What was the original name of Duran Duran?

6. What was the name of ET's favorite candy?
Rieses Pieces

7. What did people desperately try to avoid getting on "Press Your Luck?"
Whammies

8. Name 3 books by Judy Blume or Beverly Cleary
Cleary: Ramona, Ribsy, ??
Then Again, Maybe I won't, Ramona, Are You there god, it's me margaret

9. Who was the leader of the Transformers?
Optimus Prime for the Autobots, Megatron for the Deceptacons - in the   
later
series, Rodimus Prime and Galvatron.

10. Where did the Superfriends congregate and watch the latest
happenings on a big screen TV?
The Hall of Justice

11. What group did New Order evolve from?
Joy Division

12. What were the names of Kevin's best friend and girl friend on "The   
Wonder Years?"
gfriend: Winnie  best friend:?

13. What was the name of the mechanical bear on Battlestar Galactica?
Muffet?

14. What commercial was Michael Jackson singing for when his hair caught   
on fire?
Pepsi

15. Who was the 4th child on "Growing Pains?"

16. Name 3 Strawberry Shortcake characters (besides Strawberry Shortcake)
hucklberry pie, ?, ?

17. What, according to GI Joe, was "Half the battle"?
"knowing is half the battle"

18. What was the name of the Bjork-fronted 80's band?
the sugarcubes

19. Who lamented about "No chocolate-covered candy hearts to give away   
and no wedding Saturday within the month of June"?
Stevie Wonder

20. What famous Wham! frontman went on to record a multi-platinum record   
in 1987?
George Michael.

21. What was Dustin Hoffman's character's name in "Rain Man?"
Raymond

22. Name all five New Kids On The Block
Donnie Whalberg, Jordan and Jonathan Knight, Joe McIntrye, and Danny Wood

23. What was the name of the show that featured Larry Appleton and his   
zany foreign cousin?
Perfect Strangers

24. Who played Sarah Connor in 1984's "Terminator"?
Linda Hamilton

25. Name 8 Muppets from "The Muppet Show"
Fozzy bear, kermit the frog, miss piggy, gonzo, animal, dr teeth, beaker,
the swedish chef.

26. Who was the actress that played Ferris Bueller's sister? Hint:   
Patrick Swayze showed her "the time of her life" in a movie a couple   
years later
Jennifer Grey

27. Who was the original singer of Los Lobos' 1987 hit "La Bamba"?
Richie Valens?

28. What was the name of the once Morrissey-fronted band in the 80's?
The Smiths

29. Who was the actress that made waves in 1984's "Splash"?
Darryl Hannah

30. Who was the lead actress in the famous bomb "Grease 2"?

31. What craft toy involved cutting plastic figures, coloring them in,   
and then baking them in the oven?
Shrinkey Dinks

32. Name 3 glam rock bands of the 80's
 Poison, Warrant, ummmm...  Enuff Z'Nuff?  ;)

33. What planet was Spock brought back to life on?
Genesis

34. Name 3 of the actors from "The Goonies"
Cyndi Lauper, Corey Feldman...  am I thinking of the right movie here?

35. What was the famous line uttered by an old woman in Wendy's ads?
"Where's the beef?"

36. Name the four ghosts from Pac-Man
Inky, Pinky, Blinky, and Clyde

37. What were the names of the Saturday morning cartoon critters who   
lived in air-vents and befriended a boy who kept their secret hidden?

38. Name Eddie Murphy's skit about vocabulary on Saturday Night Live

39. What was the name of Michael Knight's car? ....now, what was the name   
of his boss?
Kitt, and Devon

40. What actor mouthed the line "Whatch you talkin' 'bout Willis?"
Gary Coleman

41. Who played Axel Foley's best friend in Detroit?

42. What was the name of the funky van Scooby Doo and friends rode in?
the mystery machine

43. To what does the obscure song "Turning Japanese" refer?
Masturbation?

44. Which red-head won Star Search and then went on a shopping mall   
singing tour that took America by storm in 1987 and 1988?
Tiffany

45. Which band had members Robert Palmer, Andy and John Taylor,  and Tony   
Thompson?
Reflex??  Power Station?

46. What were the names of all five Huxtable kids on "The Cosby  Show?"
Denise, ?, ?, ?, ?

47. What were the names of the four Golden Girls?
Clare, ?, ?, ?

48. What was the claymation Domino's Pizza thing to avoid?
"avoid the noid"

49. What oldies song was revived by the movie about a certain principal   
named Joe Clark?

50. What was the name of Ripley's ship in Aliens? (not Alien or Alien3)

51. What TV actress costarred in 1986's "Howard The Duck"?
Lea Thompson

52. Name 5 movies made by John Hughes in the 1980's
The Breakfast Club, Pretty in Pink, Weird Science, Sixteen Candles, Some   
Kind of Wonderful

53. What was the first video played on MTV?
Video Killed the Radio Star?

54. What was the name of Garfield's teddy bear?
pooky

55. What was the name of the bartender on "The Love Boat"?
Isaac

56. Who was the head villain on "The Smurfs" and what was his cat's name?
gargamel and azrael

57. What was the name of the guy who couldn't enunciate on "The Fat   
Albert Show?"

58. What was the name of the hollow hole-covered plastic ball kids used   
to hit instead of a baseball?
Whiffle ball

59. What was the name of the singer who died in Robotech's first   
generation?
Lynn Kyle?

60. What was the name of Bo and Luke Duke's automobile?
The General Lee

61. Name 2 of the original 4 MTV VeeJays

62. What German siren sang "99 Luftballons" (known in the US as "99 Red   
Balloons")?
Nena

63. Name the 5th original member of Depeche Mode who left the band,   
formed Yaz, and then went on form a more-lasting group.
Vince Clark

64. What group sang "Come On Eileen"?
Dexie's Midnight Runners?

65. What speed did Marty have to reach in order to activate the flux   
capacitor? (once you remember the movie, this should be easy)
88 MPH

66. Name the two mega-popular bands which got their start on   
college-radio in Athens, Georgia?
REM, the B52s

67. What was the name of the heroic boy in "The Never Ending Story?
Batian

68. So, who shot JR?

69. What kind of sword did Thundar the Barbarian have?

70. What was the name of He-Man's magician sidekick?

71. What band sang the theme song to "The Breakfast Club?"
Simple Minds

72. Name the 4 girls from the "Facts of Life" and their chaperone
Tootie, Blair, Mr. Garrett, ?, Bo?

73. What gothic rock group did Tones on Tail become?
is it bauhaus? Thought it was Souixie and the Banshees

74. What were the names of the host and his sidekick on "Fantasy Island"?
Mr. Rourke and Tatoo

75. Name Buck Rodgers' pal
Tweekie

76. What was the movie that starred the little furry creatures from   
"Return of the Jedi"?
Well, they were Ewoks... what was the movie?

77. What was Tom Cruise's call sign in the movie "Top Gun"?
Maverick

78. Who got his 100-meter dash gold medal stripped away due to his   
steroid use in the 1988 Olympics?
ben johnson

79. Who sang "Shattered Dreams" in 1987?
Johnny Hates Jazz?

80. Who played Ming of Mongo in "Flash Gordon"?

There was limited response to the Rave Haiku contest.  I did get some cute
ones, especially from SDream, but I'm certain someone out there will send
something that will really pop out as a winner (Ti-Fred?  Rhea?).

I wasn't able to tell what the prize is, but now I can:

A Friends & Family patch!

  If you haven't seen one, maybe you will soon.

So, here are the rules...

THE FIRST ANNUAL SFR HAIKU CONTEST!

Please send me your top three haikus, relating to raving, rave music, the
rave scene, rave experiences, etc...

Remember a Haiku is five, seven, five...

Pretty in Pink, The Breakfast Club, 16 Candles, Ferris Beuller's Day Off

>* * * * * * * * * 80 QUESTIONS ABOUT THE EIGHTIES * * * * * * * * *
>>
>>1. What was the British equivalent of "We Are The World?"
do they know its Christmas?

>>2. Name six members of the Brat Back
Rob Lowlife,  Emilio estevez, Charlie Sheen , Molly Ringworm, that prat
Amdrew Mcarthy, that other girl. (just think of St. Elmo's fire)

>>3. What Liverpool band popularized the Doors' "People Are Strange?" in the
>>     80's?
echo & the bunnymen

>>4. Who had the trademark saying "Nanoo Nanoo?"
Mork

>>5. What was the original name of Duran Duran?
BARBARELLA (from the 1960's camp sci-fi flick starring a super-foxy Jane Fonda)

>>6. What was the name of ET's favorite candy?
uhh.....

>>7. What did people desperately try to avoid getting on "Press Your
>>     Luck?"
>>8. Name 3 books by Judy Blume or Beverly Cleary
>>9. Who was the leader of the Transformers?
>>10. Where did the Superfriends congregate and watch the latest
>>     happenings on a big screen TV?
>>11. What group did New Order evolve from?
Joy division

>>12. What were the names of Kevin's best friend and girl friend on
>>     "The Wonder Years?"
>>13. What was the name of the mechanical bear on Battlestar Galactica?

>>14. What commercial was Michael Jackson singing for when his hair
>>     caught on fire?
Pepsi

>>15. Who was the 4th child on "Growing Pains?"
>>16. Name 3 Strawberry Shortcake characters (besides Strawberry
>>     Shortcake)
>>17. What, according to GI Joe, was "Half the battle"?

>>18. What was the name of the Bjork-fronted 80's band?
Sugarcubes

>>19. Who lamented about "No chocolate-covered candy hearts to give
>>     away and no wedding Saturday within the month of June"?
Stevie Wonder (New Year's day(?)

>>20. What famous Wham! frontman went on to record a multi-platinum

Autistic :-)

>>     later

Dear Friends-

Just wanted to add a few comments about the recent New Moon party at Goat
Rock. I've been working as a DJ, sound person and organizer with the New
Moon collective for almost 2 years now and this last party was very
special.

To those people whining about the location you should think about why you
came to this party. For the few of us that put this on it is a sacred
pilgrimage that requires hard work and sacrifice. It is more to us than
just a party. Dance and celebration are of course very important but the
opportunity to create community and honor the Earth are equally important.
Goat Rock definitely demands extra effort. For Ann, Philip,Greg S. and me
this party took almost 24 hrs of non-stop effort and some other technical
and organizational time. It was well worth it but tiring.

This party was also a graduation party for Dr. Anne Loraine.
Congratulations, Anne and thanks for all your hard work. You were the
central person for this go around and you did a great job!!!

Respect also to:

Philip: for contributing sound equipment, expertise & nrg

Greg S.: for the main sound system, dedication & positive nrg

Tim: For hauling the system, getting there early, staying late  even with
cracked ribs

James: for hauling stufff and overall vibe assistance

Maureen: for a beautiful ceremony, altar and serious Goddess nrg

Bonnie: for an excellent set and her beautiful presence

Michelle: for being you & the massage, glad you got the chance to just come
and enjoy this one. You deserved it!

To all the other DJ's: Jim Cyr, Tracy, Claire,Roger,Tom & BioJeff thanks
for great tunes (it ain't easy hauling records up the beach!). People were
quite pleased with the variety and quality.

And to everyone else who helped set up and break down.

I camped at the party spot on Sun night and left Mon morning and the beach
was cleaned up well!!

If people want this party to continue it needs some more dedicated people
to take charge. If any one is interested email me or Ann at
anthrax@uclink.berkeley.edu.

Thank you Great Spirit for watching over our event!

All The Best,
Ronan

"Speak to the Earth and it shall teach thee." -Job 12:7

Dave Byer wrote:

>> THE BAD: First let me say, this location was WAY THE HELL OUT THERE!  Dang, 
>> folks, surely there's got to be a spot like this a little closer to Frisco.  
>> Driving up to San Fran is bad enough.  Having to drive another hour and 1/2 
>> beyond that is HELL.
>	Why is an hour and a half too far to drive?...
>...	I think that bashing commerical parties for location is justified,
>after all,...
>...  but a
>free party put on by people who care for those who come out is different. 

Geez, louise, I guess I came on too strong about the remoteness of the 
location and not strong enough about how wonderful the event was.  Allow me 
to correct that:

>From my south bay perspective, the drive was bad.  I commute to work, and 
I've come to seriously despise driving.  Taken by itself, the drive did not 
contribute to the evening at all, knowhatahmean?

But the event and the location itself were spectacular.  The folx that put 
this together did an excellent job of choosing a truly incredible spot to 
have their party.  I count this as one of my better rave experiences, most 
definitely.  As others have described so eloquently, it was truly beautiful. 
 I'm afraid I missed the ceremonies -- long drive and all that -- but they 
sounded perfect.  The weather, while chilly, was not uncomfortable and 
actually made dancing just that much easier.  It really was a perfect 
setting, albeit far removed from me.  When it came time to give donations, I 
contributed generously and gave the sweet lass with the donations box a big 
hug, my way of saying, "Please do this again!"

So to reiterate, I in no way lay blame on the promoters for the distance I 
personally have to drive, I was just venting a little.  Geez, it was such a 
wonderful event, I'm just darned glad to have been there!

S

From: SDream@tgrigsby.com (SDream)
Subject: NRR: 50 Ways to Disrupt an Exam
X-Mailer: <PC Eudora Version 1.4>
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


For all you students out there...

----------------------------------

*File Description: 50 Ways to Disrupt an Exam*


 50 Fun things to do in a final that does not matter (i.e. you are going
    to fail the class completely no matter what you get on the final exam)
 
 
   1.  Bring a pillow. Fall asleep (or pretend to) until the last 15
   minutes. Wake up, say "oh geez, better get cracking" and do some
   gibberish work. Turn it in a few minutes early.
 
   2.  Get a copy of the exam, run out screaming "Andre, Andre, I've go
   the secret documents!!"
 
   3.  If it is a math/science exam, answer in essay form. If it is long
   answer/essay form, answer with numbers and symbols. Be creative. Use the
   integral symbol.
 
   4.  Make paper airplanes out of the exam. Aim them at the instructor's
   left nostril.
 
   5.  Talk the entire way through the exam. Read questions aloud, debate
   your answers with yourself out loud. If asked to stop, yell out, "I'm
   SOOO sure you can hear me thinking." Then start talking about what a
   jerk the instructor is.
 
   6.  Bring cheerleaders.
 
   7.  Walk in, get the exam, sit down. About five minutes into it, loudly
   say to the instructor, "I don't understand ANY of this. I've been to
   every lecture all semester long! What's the deal? And who the hell are
   you? Where's the regular guy?"
 
   8.  Bring a Game Boy (or Game Gear, etc...). Play with the volume at max
   level.
 
   9.  On the answer sheet (book, whatever) find a new, interesting way to
   refuse to answer every question. For example: I refuse to answer this
   question on the grounds that it conflicts with my religious beliefs. Be
   creative.
 
   10.  Bring pets.
 
   11.  Run into the exam room looking about frantically. Breathe a sigh of
   relief. Go to the instructor, say "They've found me, I have to leave the
   country" and run off.
 
   12.  Fifteen minutes into the exam, stand up, rip up all the papers into
   very small pieces, throw them into the air and yell out "Merry
   Christmas."  If you're really daring, ask for another copy of the exam.
   Say you lost the first one. Repeat this process every fifteen minutes.
 
   13.  Do the exam with crayons, paint, or fluorescent markers.
 
   14.  Come into the exam wearing slippers, a bathrobe, a towel on your
   head, and nothing else.
 
   15.  Come down with a BAD case of Turet's Syndrome during the exam. Be
   as vulgar as possible.
 
   16.  Do the entire exam in another language. If you don't know one, make
   one up!  For math/science exams, try using Roman numerals.
 
   17.  Bring things to throw at the instructor when s/he's not looking.
   Blame it on the person nearest to you.
 
   18.  As soon as the instructor hands you the exam, eat it.
 
   19.  Walk into the exam with an entourage. Claim you are going to be
   taping your next video during the exam. Try to get the instructor to let
   them stay, be persuasive. Tell the instructor to expect a percentage of
   the profits if they are allowed to stay.
 
   20.  Every five minutes, stand up, collect all your things, move to
   another seat, continue with the exam.
 
   21.  Turn in the exam approximately 30 minutes into it. As you walk out,
   start commenting on how easy it was.
 
   22.  Do the entire exam as if it was multiple choice and true/false. If
   it is a multiple choice exam, spell out interesting things (DCCAB. BABE.
   etc..).
 
   23.  Bring a black marker. Return the exam with all questions and
   answers completely blacked out.
 
   24.  Get the exam. Twenty minutes into it, throw your papers down
   violently, scream out "Fuck this!" and walk out triumphantly.
 
   25.  Arrange a protest before the exam starts (i.e. Threaten the
   instructor that whether or not everyone's done, they are all leaving
   after one hour to go drink)
 
   26.  Show up completely drunk. (Completely drunk means at some point
   during the exam, you should start crying for mommy).
 
   27.  Every now and then, clap twice rapidly. If the instructor asks why,
   tell him/her in a very derogatory tone, "the light bulb that goes on
   above my head when I get an idea is hooked up to a clapper. DUH!"
 
   28.  Comment on how sexy the instructor is looking that day.
 
   29.  Come to the exam wearing a black cloak. After about 30 minutes, put
   on a white mask and start yelling "I'm here, the phantom of the opera"
   until they drag you away.
 
   30.  Go to an exam for a class you have no clue about, where you know
   the class is very small, and the instructor would recognize you if you
   belonged.  Claim that you have been to every lecture. Fight for your
   right to take the exam.
 
   31.  Upon receiving the exam, look it over, while laughing loudly, say
   "you don't really expect me to waste my time on this drivel? Days of our
   Lives is on!!!"
 
   32.  Bring a water pistol with you. Nuff said.
 
   33.  From the moment the exam begins, hum the theme to Jeopardy. Ignore
   the instructor's requests for you to stop. When they finally get you to
   leave one way or another, begin whistling the theme to the Bridge on the
   River Kwai.
 
   34.  Start a brawl in the middle of the exam.
 
   35.  If the exam is math/science related, make up the longest proofs you
   could possibly think of. Get pi and imaginary numbers into most
   equations. If it is a written exam, relate everything to your own life
   story.
 
   36.  Come in wearing a full knight's outfit, complete with sword and
   shield.
 
   37.  Bring a friend to give you a back massage the entire way through
   the exam. Insist this person is needed, because you have bad circulation.
 
   38.  Bring cheat sheets FOR ANOTHER CLASS (make sure this is obvious...
   like history notes for a calculus exam... otherwise you're not just
   failing, you're getting kicked out too) and staple them to the exam,
   with the comment "Please use the attached notes for references as you see
   fit."
 
   39.  When you walk in, complain about the heat. Strip.
 
   40.  After you get the exam, call the instructor over, point to any
   question, ask for the answer. Try to work it out of him/her.
 
   41.  One word: Wrestlemania.
 
   42.  Bring balloons, blow them up, start throwing them around like they
   do before concerts start.
 
   43.  Try to get people in the room to do the wave.
 
   44.  Play frisbee with a friend at the other side of the room.
 
   45.  Bring some large, cumbersome, ugly idol. Put it right next to you.
   Pray to it often. Consider a small sacrifice.
 
   46.  Get deliveries of candy, flowers, balloons, telegrams, etc... sent
   to you every few minutes throughout the exam.
 
   47.  During the exam, take apart everything around you. Desks, chairs,
   anything you can reach.
 
   48.  Complete the exam with everything you write being backwards at a 90
   degree angle.
 
   49.  Bring a musical instrument with you, play various tunes. If you are
   asked to stop, say "it helps me think." Bring a copy of the Student
   Handbook with you, challenging the instructor to find the section on musical
   instruments during finals. Don't forget to use the phrase "Told you so".
 
   50.  Answer the exam with the "Top Ten Reasons Why Professor xxxx Sucks"

>>>     Island"?

>>>>* * * * * * * * * 80 QUESTIONS ABOUT THE EIGHTIES * * * * * * * * *
>>>>
>>>>1. What was the British equivalent of "We Are The World?"
feed the world
>>>>2. Name six members of the Brat Back
rob lowlife, emilio estevez, charlie sheen, molly ringworm, andrew mccarthy,
judd nelson, anthony michael hall
>>>>3. What Liverpool band popularized the Doors' "People Are Strange?" in the
>>>>     80's?
echo and the bunnymen
>>>>4. Who had the trademark saying "Nanoo Nanoo?"
>mork 
>>>>5. What was the original name of Duran Duran?
barbarella _or_ RAF, depending on who you believe.
>>>>6. What was the name of ET's favorite candy?
>reece's pieces
>>>>7. What did people desperately try to avoid getting on "Press Your
>>>>     Luck?"
>>>>8. Name 3 books by Judy Blume or Beverly Cleary
>>>>9. Who was the leader of the Transformers?
>Optimus Prime for the Autobots, Megatron for the Deceptacons - in the later
series, Rodimus Prime and Galvatron.
>>>>10. Where did the Superfriends congregate and watch the latest
>>>>     happenings on a big screen TV?
>>>>11. What group did New Order evolve from?
joy division
>>>>12. What were the names of Kevin's best friend and girl friend on
>>>>     "The Wonder Years?"
>gfriend: Winnie  best friend:?
>>>>13. What was the name of the mechanical bear on Battlestar Galactica?
>>>>14. What commercial was Michael Jackson singing for when his hair
>>>>     caught on fire?
pepsi
>>>>15. Who was the 4th child on "Growing Pains?"
>>>>16. Name 3 Strawberry Shortcake characters (besides Strawberry
>>>>     Shortcake)
>hucklberry pie, ?, ?
>>>>17. What, according to GI Joe, was "Half the battle"?
>"knowing is half the battle"
>>>>18. What was the name of the Bjork-fronted 80's band?
>the sugarcubes
>>>>19. Who lamented about "No chocolate-covered candy hearts to give
>>>>     away and no wedding Saturday within the month of June"?
stevie wonder
>>>>20. What famous Wham! frontman went on to record a multi-platinum
>>>>     record in 1987?
>george michael.
>>>>21. What was Dustin Hoffman's character's name in "Rain Man?"
raymond
>>>>22. Name all five New Kids On The Block
>donny, jordon, ?, ?, ?
>>>>23. What was the name of the show that featured Larry Appleton and
>>>>     his zany foreign cousin?
>>>>24. Who played Sarah Connor in 1984's "Terminator"?
linda hamilton
>>>>25. Name 8 Muppets from "The Muppet Show"
>fozzy bear, kermit the frog, miss piggy, gonzo, animal, dr teeth, beaker,
the swedish chef.
>>>>26. Who was the actress that played Ferris Bueller's sister? Hint:
>>>>     Patrick Swayze showed her "the time of her life" in a movie a couple
>>>>     years
>>>>     later
>>>>27. Who was the original singer of Los Lobos' 1987 hit "La Bamba"?
>>>>28. What was the name of the once Morrissey-fronted band in the 80's?
the smiths
>>>>29. Who was the actress that made waves in 1984's "Splash"?
daryl hannah
>>>>30. Who was the lead actress in the famous bomb "Grease 2"?
>>>>31. What craft toy involved cutting plastic figures, coloring them
>>>>     in, and then baking them in the oven?
shrinky dinks
>>>>32. Name 3 glam rock bands of the 80's
motley crue, poison, bon jovi, europe, cinderella, kiss
>>>>33. What planet was Spock brought back to life on?
>>>>34. Name 3 of the actors from "The Goonies"
corey something, ?
>>>>35. What was the famous line uttered by an old woman in Wendy's ads?
where's the beef?
>>>>36. Name the four ghosts from Pac-Man
>blinky, pinky, winky, and ? (all i remember is that it doesn't rhyme)
>>>>37. What were the names of the Saturday morning cartoon critters who
>>>>     lived in air-vents and befriended a boy who kept their secret hidden?
>>>>38. Name Eddie Murphy's skit about vocabulary on Saturday Night Live
mr robinson's reighborhood
>>>>39. What was the name of Michael Knight's car? ....now, what was the
>>>>     name of his boss?
car=kitt boss=
>>>>40. What actor mouthed the line "Whatch you talkin' 'bout Willis?"
gary coleman
>>>>41. Who played Axel Foley's best friend in Detroit?
judge rheinhold ?
>>>>42. What was the name of the funky van Scooby Doo and friends rode
>>>>     in?
>the mystery machine
>>>>43. To what does the obscure song "Turning Japanese" refer?
>>>>44. Which red-head won Star Search and then went on a shopping mall
>>>>     singing tour that took America by storm in 1987 and 1988?
tiffany
>>>>45. Which band had members Robert Palmer, Andy and John Taylor,  and
>>>>     Tony Thompson?
power station
>>>>46. What were the names of all five Huxtable kids on "The Cosby
>>>>     Show?"
lisa, ?
>>>>47. What were the names of the four Golden Girls?
>>>>48. What was the claymation Domino's Pizza thing to avoid?
>"avoid the noid"
>>>>49. What oldies song was revived by the movie about a certain
>>>>     principal named Joe Clark?
>>>>50. What was the name of Ripley's ship in Aliens? (not Alien or
>>>>     Alien3)
>>>>51. What TV actress costarred in 1986's "Howard The Duck"?
lea thompson
>>>>52. Name 5 movies made by John Hughes in the 1980's
the breakfast club, pretty in pink, ferris bueller's day off, wierd science,
16 candles
>>>>53. What was the first video played on MTV?
>>>>54. What was the name of Garfield's teddy bear?
>pooky
>>>>55. What was the name of the bartender on "The Love Boat"?
>>>>56. Who was the head villain on "The Smurfs" and what was his cat's
>>>>     name?
>gargamel and azrael
>>>>57. What was the name of the guy who couldn't enunciate on "The Fat
>>>>     Albert Show?"
>>>>58. What was the name of the hollow hole-covered plastic ball kids
>>>>     used to hit instead of a baseball?
whiffle ball
>>>>59. What was the name of the singer who died in Robotech's first
>>>>     generation?
>>>>60. What was the name of Bo and Luke Duke's automobile?
the general lee
>>>>61. Name 2 of the original 4 MTV VeeJays
adam curry, ?
>>>>62. What German siren sang "99 Luftballons" (known in the US as "99
>>>>     Red Balloons")?
nena
>>>>63. Name the 5th original member of Depeche Mode who left the band,
>>>>     formed Yaz, and then went on form a more-lasting group.
vince clarke
>>>>64. What group sang "Come On Eileen"?
dexys midnight runners
>>>>65. What speed did Marty have to reach in order to activate the flux
>>>>     capacitor? (once you remember the movie, this should be easy)
80 mph
>>>>66. Name the two mega-popular bands which got their start on
>>>>     college-radio in Athens, Georgia?
>REM, B-52's
>>>>67. What was the name of the heroic boy in "The Never Ending Story?
>>>>68. So, who shot JR?
>the fucking FBI/masons/aliens
>>>>69. What kind of sword did Thundar the Barbarian have?
>>>>70. What was the name of He-Man's magician sidekick?
>>>>71. What band sang the theme song to "The Breakfast Club?"
simple minds
>>>>72. Name the 4 girls from the "Facts of Life" and their chaperone
>>>>73. What gothic rock group did Tones on Tail become?
>>>>74. What were the names of the host and his sidekick on "Fantasy
>>>>     Island"?
mr. rorke and tattoo
>>>>75. Name Buck Rodgers' pal
>>>>76. What was the movie that starred the little furry creatures from
>>>>     "Return of the Jedi"?
>>>>77. What was Tom Cruise's call sign in the movie "Top Gun"?
bandit
>>>>78. Who got his 100-meter dash gold medal stripped away due to his
>>>>     steroid use in the 1988 Olympics?
>ben johnson
>>>>79. Who sang "Shattered Dreams" in 1987?
>>>>80. Who played Ming of Mongo in "Flash Gordon"?
>
>hmm.. well, maybe i didn't do as well as i originally thought. 
>please, enlighten me!

Here are some more.  Embarassingly enough, I actually got most of them, but
these are just some that I haven't seen answered (or wrong answers)


>>13. What was the name of the mechanical bear on Battlestar Galactica?
It was Boxey. And he was a dog ("Moffet" or "Moppet" was the species).

>>39. What was the name of Michael Knight's car? ....now, what was the
>>     name of his boss?
Car: Kitt of course.  Boss (this is embarassing :) - Devon _Miles_

>>43. To what does the obscure song "Turning Japanese" refer?
Going crazy. (OBSCURE!!?!?!)
 
>>53. What was the first video played on MTV?
The Buggles' "Video Killed the Radio Star" (someone already mentioned the title)

>>57. What was the name of the guy who couldn't enunciate on "The Fat
>>     Albert Show?"
Mush Mouth

>>59. What was the name of the singer who died in Robotech's first
>>     generation?
I'm pretty sure it was Min Mei (Rick Hunter's girlfriend) Good riddance, too ;)

>>70. What was the name of He-Man's magician sidekick?
Someone mentioned Battle Cat: That was his steed.  The magician was the little
guy with the red robe with the black circle on the chest and the wizard's hat
that covered most of his face.  What was his name??

>>72. Name the 4 girls from the "Facts of Life" and their chaperone
Tootie, Jo, Blair, Natalie and Mrs Garret (from Different Strokes...)

>>73. What gothic rock group did Tones on Tail become?
Love and Rockets
 
>>76. What was the movie that starred the little furry creatures from
>>     "Return of the Jedi"?
Ewoks: Return to Endor (I think)
 
>>80. Who played Ming of Mongo in "Flash Gordon"?
Frack! (remember that curse word?  Who said that?...) It's on the tip of my
tongue (Queen did the soundtrack, though:)

Oh yeah, I don't think anyone mentioned Martha Quinn as one of the original
MTV VJ's.

Why do I only remember useless information?
-mike

Hello again,

I seem to have been having some problems with my e-mail address and 
only some of my mail has been reaching me, if you would like to join 
in with this discussion please e-mail me at 

Davidt@londonantique.com

So, just for the hell of it here is a repeat of my previous note.

Interesting feedback so far, perhaps there are more gays at raves 
than I thought, but even so it would be nice to see more. I am going 
to start inviting all my gay friends and all of their gay friends and 
get a whole gays at raves pyramid going.

I love the idea of this mix of people, I don't think we should be 
having to choose whether to go to a "Gay" party or a "Straight" 
party, my friendships are not based on sexual orientation so it 
will be a fabulous party when we can all go out with our friends and no 
matter whether you are straight/gay/lesbian/bi/bi-curious/straight 
curious/gender non-specific/or a-sexual you can party with others 
just like you and celebrate diversity without feeling alone. Utopia 
is right at our fingertips and I want to party there!

Please keep this dicussion going and please invite all your friends 
to join in.

TTFN

David

#13 is Muffitt, not Boxey (Boxey was the boy), and the species was a
Dagitt, not a dog.
#53: Once in a Lifetime (Talking Heads; this is documented).  Video Killed
the Radio Star was the first "music video" ever made for the purpose of
being a music video, but it wasn't the first to air on MTV.

| _Query_ : How contrive not to waste one's time?                       |
|                                                                       |
| _Answer_: By being fully aware of it all the while.  Ways in which    |
|           this can be done: By spending one's days on an uneasy chair |
|           in a dentist's waiting-room; by remaining on one's balcony  |
|           all of a Sunday afternoon; by listening to lectures in a    |
|           language one doesn't know; by traveling by the longest and  |
|           least-convenient train routes, and of course standing all   |
|           the way; by lining up at the box-office of theaters and     |
|           and then not buying a seat; and so forth.                   |
|                                                                       |
|    - albert camus, _la peste_                                         |

Hi folks!

Thank you all for the wonderful posts on the New Moon.  Would it be al
right with the folks that posted if we put some of your posts up on the
New Moon web pages? (http://sfraves/raves/newmoon) 

Also, I am not particularly bummed out about people thinking that it was
kind of far to go for a party.  We took a risk by going out there...'cause
there always was a chance that the rangers would chase us away, and it
would have sucked in a big way if we had been evicted from the spot after
doing so much work for the party.  We probably won't do another party
there for a while- so as not to annoy the rangers.  It really is the ONLY
spot left that I know of where we could have such a large outdoor party
without getting kicked out.  I worry that having had the party there may
have ruined the place for future parties, but I think if we leave it alone
for a while, it will be okay to do parties there in future.    

And thank you Ronan for sticking around there the next few days and making
sure the place was completely cleaned up!!!  


Much respect and love to you all,

Ann

We usually try to let lots of people know about the party, and where it
will be, ahead of time.  But there's only a few of us in the core group
planning each party, and there's only so much we can do to get the word
out!   For this party, we mostly just posted to sfraves to let
people know about it- after three years of doing the party, we've found
that the people that come to us from sfraves are absolutely awesome!  If
we had had the time, we might have made flyers and distributed them, but
we had our hands full just making sure our eqipment worked, that the stuff
had transportation, etc.  Making flyers is one of the funnest jobs, but
unfortunately, we just couldn't get it together to do that this time.
Also, this is a small, "experimental" party and it isn't really that
important to us to have huge numbers of people come, although it's very
nice when that happens!!!  Mostly we just want to get people together to
have a nice time, make friends, and feel a part of a community.  For many
of us, the new moon is the main time that we get to see friends that we
haven't seen for a month, and that's why the party's kept going over the
years.  

Also, our voicemail goddess (Michi!) has been putting other events on the
New Moon voicemail.  Notably, the River events, and other similar things.
So check the NM voicemail for information about other things besides the
New Moon!  415-267-3076.

We'd also like to set up some kind of "cc" list to send people email
notifying them about upcoming gatherings.  If anybody would like to add
their address to this list, send me email.  Also, you should check the web
page regualarly for updates.  We are also hoping to add pages for
individual writings- such as Jason, Cinnamon Twist!  We welcome all
contributions!!!  (http://hyperreal.com/raves/newmoon)

-Ann

From: Edwin.K.Chong@Dartmouth.EDU (Edwin K. Chong)
Reply-To: MondoMan@Dartmouth.EDU
Subject: Re: Orion...so much potential (gripe)
To: rdriffle@ucdavis.edu, sfraves@hyperreal.com
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

--- Rick Riffle wrote:
I'll definately give them another chance, and hope any of you who attended
will as well.
--- end of quoted material ---

Well, I'll agree that Orion had potential...but my friends and I left feeling
that the promoters were kinda wack, although that doesn't mean we won't give
them another chance. Our biggest gripe was about the voicemail - we called
after 8 and still couldn't get directions (even though they said it was
supposed to start at 9), so we had to drive up from Mountain View not knowing
exactly where we were going. When we got to Sacramento a little before 11, it
took a while to get thru to their voicemail, and when we did, it said that the
first space had been busted and that they were trying to get another. So we
drove around for a while killing time, and called back at random intervals.
Eventually the message changed, but all it said then was that Orion would be
going off, but you had to call back in an hour or two. Well, at least two hours
passed and the message hadn't changed, and we were getting annoyed. But then we
just happened to see a bunch of people walking around a nearby building in an
alley, and we decided to check it out, and sure enough, it was Orion. By this
time it was past 2:30 and we'd hung out killing time at every place with late
hours that we could find - Del Taco, some 24hour coffeeshop, and Safeway - so
you can imagine our mood as we discovered no main room, the power repeatedly
going out, and then the cops clearing out the whole place not too much later.
And as for nobody caring that the power kept going out...well, that might have
been the case in the ambient room (I did hear the clapping and the drums), but
people seemed a bit more annoyed in the hardcore/jungle room (at one point,
everybody started banging loudly on the pillars, which had been covered in that
packing bubble sheet stuff). I can understand how the promoters might not have
had complete control over the building's power source or the cops, but they
could've dealt with their voicemail better - like, have directions early enough
for non-Sacramento dwellers, and have directions, period. Telling people that
it's been busted and asking them to call back, and then having it resume
without updating their voicemail is not cool...

It's kinda ironic how I'd just run into one of the promoters at F-8 when I was
buying tickets, and she'd promised me it'd be worth the drive cuz it was gonna
go off...better luck next time, I guess...

*** Reply to note of 06/18/96 15:24
FROM: Robert Brown

SUBJECT:       (Fwd) MORE GAYS @ RAVES

A few thoughts on the subject....(all subjective and opinion, of course)

I used to wonder myself whether there were that many gay people at raves,
but now I'd say that there probably are more than may be obvious or known.
This may likely be, as has been pointed out, that raves aren't as
overtly sexual (vs. the stereotypical club or bar) so ones sexual orientation
is not one of the first impressions or a factor in how people interact
at raves (up to a certain point, of course).

I have invited some of my gay friends to raves and I get a couple of
different reactions.  The relevant reaction being a concern that they
won't know whether or not someone is gay and thusly fear approaching
anyone.  This is perhaps an attitude coming from the "club scene" and
I suspect the fear of gay bashing  (i.e., if I approach another guy in a
non-gay situation, even in a non-sexual manner will I get beaten up?).
This is something that gays have to worry about on occassion that hetero-
sexuals may take for granted.  For us ravers we of course realize that
this is not the climate at a rave, and that may be what is important
to impart to those gay friends you wish to bring into the scene (or at least
bring to a rave).

One factor for gays possibly prefering to go to gay clubs versus raves is
to meet other gay people, be it as friends, potential relationships, or
for sexual reasons.  Not sure where this is going, but seemed like a point to
make.

As for making a club or event more mixed, someone mentioned passing out
flyers at Club Universe.  Something to that effect could work, such as
leaving flyers at select locations/stores in the Castro (Headlines, etc.),
the Billy DeFrank Center in San Jose, and so on.  This would probably be
better suited to something like Spundae.

I think having a very mixed group is a healthy idea that I fully support
and hopefully such a mixed environment will take firm hold.

Comment on Blue Lagoon...correct me if I'm wrong, please, but isn't that
just about the only actual dance club in Santa Cruz?  If so, wouldn't this
tend to bring people in regardless of orientation, despite the fact that it
is known to be a primarily gay club?? I know there's Palookaville, but they
are primarily geared toward live bands aren't they??

Thanks for reading this far!  I've babbled long enough!

Peace,
  - R

	i guess it's time to stop lurking, and speak up on what's the fuss
over the right front speaker and the Right Front Speaker Family:

well, the right front speaker family is comprised of a number of ravers
all over the country (and possibly a few in other countries as well) who
prefer to dance in front of the right front speaker (according to where
the dj is located). 
the whole idea was originated by sarvi and i during the summer of 1994 :) 
it was basically the "home base" we created so that we knew where our
backpacks were, where others could find us, and where we can find each
other during times of separation :)
as the months progressed, we visited different parts of the US, raving
along the way. at each rave, we still used the right front speaker as
our "home base", and our friends started using the right front speaker as
their "home base" as well. and with friends visiting and raving with us in
the bay area, they started using the right front speaker as their "home
base" too! 
so the right front speaker has no fancy decorations. it doesn't
necessarily have better sound than any of the other speakers. and the
right front speaker family is not an elite group of ravers that only the
chosen may join.
why the right front speaker? well, the front speaker so we may easily see
the turntables and the dj. and the right speaker because it was just
closer in many cases! :)
the right front speaker family is open for all to join, and it is just a
place where you may find a number of your friends! and in no way does it
discriminate against those who may make up a "left front speaker family"
;)  

*GASP* 
jan finally posts ;)
hehehehe...i hope to find all of you at the right front speaker ;)
take care, and i will talk to you all later!

byebye,
...jan...
delaja00@dons.ac.usfca.edu

Message-Id: <199606190526.WAA24608@dfw-ix12.ix.netcom.com>
From: shawna-@ix.netcom.com (Shawna McGourty)
Subject: A nifty excerpt
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Hey all!

I was reading a book a while back, and I found this awesome passage in 
it which sounded startlingly familiar!  I have actually passed it out 
to a few people at various raves, but I just thought it so cool that I 
thought I'd post it to the list.

Anyway, in this book (which some of you may be familiar with), the 
Devil takes a vampire and shows him Heaven, and the following is the 
vampire's description of what Heaven is like:


        "What I saw, however, overwhelmed me as much as the sound.  
This was very simply the most profoundly magnificent place I'd ever 
beheld.  Our language needs endless synonyms for beautiful;  the eyes 
could see what the tongue cannot possibly describe.
        "Once again, people were everywhere, people filled with light, 
and of distinct anthropomorphic shape; they had arms, legs, beaming 
faces, garments of all different kinds, yet no costume of any seemingly 
great importance, and the people were moving, traveling paths in groups 
or alone, or coming together in patterns, embracing, clasping, reaching 
out, and holding hands.
        "I turned to the right and to the left, and then all around me, 
and in every direction saw these multitudes of beings, wrapped in 
conversation or dialogue or some sort of interchange, some of them 
embracing and kissing, and others dancing, and the clusters and groups 
of them continued to shift and grow or shrink and spread out.
        "Indeed, the combination of seeming disorder and order was the 
mystery.  This was not chaos.  This was not confusion.  This was not a 
din.  It seemed the hilarity of a great and final gathering, and by 
final I mean it seemed a perpetually unfolding resolution of something, 
a marvel of sustained revelation, a gathering and growing understanding 
shared by all who participated in it, as they hurried or moved 
languidly or even in some cases sat about doing very little."


Sound familiar?


Love,
Shawna

Organization: Excite, Inc.
X-Mailer: Mozilla 2.0 (X11; I; SunOS 5.5 sun4m)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: DAVID@best.com
CC: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: Re: GAYS @ RAVES (Long Response)
References: <199606131740.KAA12516@shellx.best.com>
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Hello all!

First of all, I couldn't help but respond to this message because I 
ABSOLUTELY LOVE our scene and ABSOLUTELY EVERYONE in it! Through your
positive energy and love you all have changed my life in such a positive
way that words cannot describe it and for that I will be eternally
grateful. My purpose and message in this post is to purely offer my
opinion on this topic and NOT to start a negative email campaign. 

I believe that there are already a representative portion of people,
possibly more?, at raves who consider themselves gay, lesbian, bi, etc.
I wouldn't say I'm unique but I used to consider myself to be 100% gay
and now consider myself to be bi...you always hear about people who
thought they were 100% straight and then realize that they are gay or bi
but rarely, if ever?, the other way around! I think that the question
of "How can we draw more gays (or more of any group) into our scene?"
should be re-phrased into "How can we draw THOSE PEOPLE who are on a
search, a SPIRITUAL MISSION, to find the answers to their life's
questions into our scene?". We all know that PART of what makes our
scene extremely special and sacred is the fact that there is no emphasis
whatsoever on sex, sexuality, race, religion, etc. When we gather at
parties we become ONE...there is no gay/straight, man/woman, 
white/black, old/young, rich/poor etc...we simply see each other as
beautiful people and ultimately we can become one pure energy mass of
love. This is what drew me to the scene and not whether or not I would
find other gay, bi-sexual, straight, etc. people at raves. I had become
so disillusioned at the spiritual emptiness of the clubs in general that
I felt as if I were losing my soul. I would be with friends but it was
extremely hard to give off positive energy when all I would hear is
people trying to pick on someone or impress a date/friend by cutting up
on other people for who they were or what they were wearing or what they
looked like.

I know that not everyone is ready or wants to receive what our scene has
to offer, some would even seek to misuse or destroy it, however, we must
have compassion and love for those who harm us since they deserve as
much as anyone else to be a part of our vision and hope of a future
world where there is no want and no pain. A world where the young, old
and sick are taken care of. A world where the environment is whole
again.

Well, I've said enough and hopefully the right stuff!? I would just like
to close out with a small message to all of you, men and women, whom I
consider to be my friend whether or not we've met:

Please understand that when I offer a piece of candy or a massage, I do
it out of my LOVE in my heart for YOU and I expect absolutely NOTHING in
return, not even a thank you...I just LOVE to give and do not want or
expect any recognition or praise. I know that when I give you LOVE, it's
contagious and causes you, in turn, to pass it on to others and so on
and so on! That's what that positive vibe is all about! Nonetheless, I
completely understand if any of you are uncomfortable about your new
found knowledge about me. Please know that I will NOT use the usual
excuse of, "Well, I guess that person wasn't my friend anyway!" because
I will always love you as my friend with all my heart forever.

Peace and Love!
John

Message-Id: <1.5.4.32.19960619143420.0067cbd4@email.org>
X-Sender: knucklehead@email.org

Subject: Gays & raves, does it matter!?
Sender: owner-sfraves@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

   People would be surprised if they actually knew how many gays, lesians,
bi people that are at a rave. Do you goto a rave to look for just that? I
hope people goto them because of the music, vibe, and love that is there.
That's why I go. Ever since I've started raving my life has been change for
the good. I've never been happier. I remember before raving I had a closed
opinion about gay males. I didn't care for them and thought they were sick
and should be put on and island by themselves. Women didn't bother me, maybe
because I like women and it's great to see two of them together. Anyway,
since raving it has open my eyes. It shouldn't matter. As long as everyone
is happy with there choices in life. Why should it matter if there are gay,
straight, lesbian, bi people at a rave? It's all about who we are inside
that should matter. I know it would be nice to have an equal amount of all
types of people there, hell I'd love it if there were nothing but straight
women at a rave, BUT that's not what it's about and not what it should be
about. We need a mix of people to experience what others half to offer. Each
person is different in there own way and when they bring that to a rave
sometimes it spread to others, and improves the lifes that it touched some
how. I use to think hugging another guy always felt wierd and didn't want
people to see me do it. Now, why should it matter. Do you feel wierd when
you shake someone hand that is the same sex? No, then why should a hug.

  I'm not sure if any of this is off the subject, because when I saw the
original post and read it, I didn't have an interest to read the others
because for the fact that it shouldn't matter who is at a rave. As long as
there heart is open and in the right place and has the love for the scene of
raving and all that it brings to each of us it really shouldn't matter, it
wouldn't be as good if there was only a certain type of people at a rave,
it's the combination of several types of people that make this scene what it
is today. A GREAT ONE! and I LOVE it!

Tim (knucklehead)

OK, this is fun.  Don't be shy.
Anyone can come up with a haiku:  Here's 3 of mine:

* * *

Together in dance
I laughed with eternity
Music is timeless

* * *

Dancing and Sweating
A long line for the bathroom
Fluids in motion

* * *

Spinning and twirling
I transcended my limits 
Puked up a blowpop


Lee

hooray for you! :)  i know a LOT of guys who wouldn't be willing to 
change their concept of gays.  It saddens me, but oh well.

And you're right - why does it matter who gets up to what?  i don't go to 
raves looking for bedmates, and i would hope that isn't first on most 
ravers' lists.  I'm enjoy either myself (although WAY more picky about my 
womenfolk - probably because i'm still learning) but if all i'm doing is 
dancing and interacting, who cares.

The thing i like about raving is that none of the typical "club 
mentality" is there, for the most part .... i'm much more open to people 
at raves than i am in a club.  I don't feel like someon's gonna try 
REALLY HARD to get me to dance with him/her or start invading my space 
unless they're welcomed by me.  You know what i mean?  there's nothing 
more annoying than someone who won't leave you alone to the point where 
you HAVE to be rude cos they won't take a hint ....

well, i just got up and am still kinda in sleep mode so ... off to get 
ready for yet ANOTHER grueling day at Ye Olde Law Firm.  :P

peace
k

Karen wrote:
>The thing i like about raving is that none of the typical "club 
>mentality" is there...
>...I don't feel like someon's gonna try 
>REALLY HARD to get me to dance with him/her...

BINGO.  And I hate feeling like I have to get someone to dance with me, 
cause in a club guys look a little stupid dancing by themselves.  And I 
REALLY hate getting shot down, nasty looks and all, like I'm trying to pick 
up on someone when *all* I wanted was to DANCE!  And I hate the feel of the 
hunt around me, guys posing, women acting aloof, pick-up lines thick as 
smoke in the air, at least one couple practically having sex on the dance 
floor.  I just want to have fun, and I want it to feel like I'm out with a 
large group of friends, not a bunch of predatory strangers.

AAAARRRRRGGGGHHHH!!!!!!

jan wrote:

> 	i guess it's time to stop lurking, and speak up on what's the fuss
> over the right front speaker and the Right Front Speaker Family:
> 
> well, the right front speaker family is comprised of a number of ravers
> all over the country (and possibly a few in other countries as well) who
> prefer to dance in front of the right front speaker (according to where
> the dj is located). 
> the whole idea was originated by sarvi and i during the summer of 1994 :) 
> it was basically the "home base" we created so that we knew where our
> backpacks were, where others could find us, and where we can find each
> other during times of separation :)
> as the months progressed, we visited different parts of the US, raving
> along the way. at each rave, we still used the right front speaker as
> our "home base", and our friends started using the right front speaker as
> their "home base" as well. and with friends visiting and raving with us in
> the bay area, they started using the right front speaker as their "home
> base" too! 
> so the right front speaker has no fancy decorations. it doesn't
> necessarily have better sound than any of the other speakers. and the
> right front speaker family is not an elite group of ravers that only the
> chosen may join.
> why the right front speaker? well, the front speaker so we may easily see
> the turntables and the dj. and the right speaker because it was just
> closer in many cases! :)
> the right front speaker family is open for all to join, and it is just a
> place where you may find a number of your friends! and in no way does it
> discriminate against those who may make up a "left front speaker family"
> ;)  
> 
> *GASP* 
> jan finally posts ;)
> hehehehe...i hope to find all of you at the right front speaker ;)
> take care, and i will talk to you all later!
> 
> byebye,
> ...jan...
> delaja00@dons.ac.usfca.edu
>

think I'll beg, borrow or

Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.com

Precedence: bulk

Dissimination of Information:

> Strychnine isn't strong enough to have any effect in the small doses 
> you'd need to try and fit it on a tab/in a microdot.  I usd to think so 
> too, but strychnine in acid is an urban legend ....

Well for anybody who cares, here's what I've picked up over the years:
1.  the "urban legend" I'm sure everybody has heard, that strychnine
(or speed) was added to acid to give you that body-buzz and enhance the
effect.  Never having met anybody that made acid, I believed it.
2.  Flipside magazine a couple of years ago ran a series of articles,
"Just Say Know", one of which was dedicated to acid (I can give exact
references to anybody that wants) where the author gave the low-down on
the dozen or so variations on the lsd molecule each of which had
slightly different effects ranging from nothing at all to mind/body
blowing experences (lsd-25 being the best)  As he pointed out, most
people cooking probably don't know about these let alone how to test
for them and how to guarentee a particular variant.  Some of those
variants gave the body-buzz, hot-cold flashes, stomache cramps, etc...
normally associated with strychnine--i.e., there is no strychnine in acid
3. Last fall, I met a person who claimed to have cooked acid with
`professionals' and he said they `painted' the sheets of paper used for
blotter with strychnine as a preservative.

There's my collected knowledge on the subject, you make the call.

I am not promoting the use of LSD as that would be inappropriate on
this list and inappropriate to several hundre people I don't know-
-it's not for everybody.  As the scientist who discovered LSD says,
"LSD is for the prepared mind"

Tim -- lurking no more

P.S. Feel free to correct or add to anything I stated above (perhaps by
     direct reply to me if it's not appropriate for the list)

I have been there a couple of times before, the last time was to see Banco
De Gaia 
perform a few months ago. That was a great show.
The venue is a decent size, maybe holda a couple of thou'
 with good acoustics and impressive sound system.
It's usually used for industrial nights such as Terminator & Bondage a Go-go.
I think the Terminator club is on after the show, so i'll hop, skip and Jump
elsewhere to hear *happy* tunes.
Staetegic spot for dancing ? wherever you feel like it I guess.

btw, the show ticket i have looks el cheopo, surely they could have designed
something a litttle more asthetically pleasing.........

See you there.

Peace 

Ciaran

On Wed, 19 Jun 1996, George Feil wrote:

> 
> So, anyway, can anyone tell me what the Trocadero is like? This will
> be my first visit there. Are there any particularly strategic spots
> for dancing or listening there?

The Trocadero is weird. They have a reputation for disliking the ravers 
that pay their bills, have problems with people bringing in any kind of 
containers ((sealed or empty)) and have been know to shut off the air 
conditioning to increase their bottled water sales. 

I saw the Chemical Brothers when they played at The Trocedero last year. 
$10 sunday night show with Jeno & Garth opening, which I thought was a 
good bill. The crowd was a strong mix of generic clubbers, kid DJ's, and 
a few raver types. like I said, Jeno & Garth opened and for the first few 
hours it had a disco feel to it, with room to dance and people doing just 
that. I was upstairs in the opium den/ ambient room when the Chemical 
Brothers took stage and everybody bolted downstairs. Below it became *very* 
packed, & dance floor was transformed into a Beastie Boys or any other 
kind of traditional stage show deal where the entire crowd was just kind 
of watching the TV up on stage and bopping their heads along. I danced in 
my sXe pose for most of the night & tried not to poke anybody in the eye.

After the Chemical Brothers ((60-80 min ?)) set about 60% of the crowd took 
off and Garth & Jeno tag teamed on the decks for another hour or so, once 
again transforning the place into a dance floor before the the Trocadero 
shut down at around 1:30 - 2am. Cool people showed up & I'm glad I went.

> 
> Who else on the list is going?
> 
> -G-
> 
>

Message-Id: <9606191150.ZM12870@horatio.ucsf.edu>
Date: Wed, 19 Jun 1996 11:50:40 -0700
In-Reply-To: timb@nit.AirTouch.COM (Tim Beauchamp)
        "Re: possibly important: bad tabs?" (Jun 19, 11:09am)
References: <9606191809.AA06348@nit.AirTouch.COM>
X-Mailer: Z-Mail (3.2.0 26oct94 MediaMail)
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com

Mime-Version: 1.0
